title: Diwali
description: Michael encourages the entire Scranton branch to support Kelly and attend a local celebration of Diwali, the Hindu Festival of Lights. Meanwhile, Andy convinces Jim to turn a late night of work into a drinking game.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice dress, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's not a dress. It's a kurta.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight, one of our most ethnic co-workers, Kelly, has invited us all to a Diwali celebration put on by her community. What is Diwali, you may ask? Well, to have Kelly explain it [girly voice] it's ada blah blah blah, it's so super fun and it's going to be great. [normal voice] Lot of gods with unpronounceable names. Twenty minutes later you find out that is essentially a Hindu Halloween.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You look so handsome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really you do. I love the material.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How come you didn't get me one?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ok, so, between Meredith's Mini-van and if I borrow Bob's Yukon that should fit about twelve people.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I actually might not go. Feeling kind of tired.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Do you want to make Appletini's and watch 'Sex and the City' at my place?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I don't know. I haven't decided yet.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't get why you won't go. Did I do something wrong? I mean, I thought we were really close friends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just feel kind of tired, you know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe you've got mono.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe. I just ...I don't really have anyone to go with.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, go with Dwight. He's single, too. Right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, totally single. Hundred percent available.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you guys going to this Indian thing tonight?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I don't know. Who's... uh, who's going?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oooh. Do you mean like, is Pam going?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don't go. They eat monkey brains.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Hey. Stop that. That is offensive. Indians do not eat monkey brains. And if they do... sign me up... because I am sure that they are very tasty and nutritional.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's important that this company celebrates its diversity. And you know what, Stanley? Come Kwanzaa time, I have got you covered, baby.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't celebrate Kwanzaa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wha? Really? You should! It's fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I love the people here. And if there was one thing I di... don't really care for is that they can be terribly, terribly ignorant about other cultures. And I don't want them embarrassing me in front of my girlfriend, Carol.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Diwali is a very important holiday for the Hindus. But, frankly, I'm a little appalled that none of you know very much about Indian culture. So, without further ado, Kelly you are on.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um... Diwali is awesome... and there's food... and there's going to be dancing... and... Oh! I got the raddest outfit. It has, um...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Sparkles...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um... why don't you tell us a little bit about the origins of the holiday.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, um... I don't know. It's really old, I think.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How many gods do you have?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Like hundreds, I think. Maybe more than that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [points at picture on the wall] And that blue busty gal? What's her story?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: She looks like Pam from the neck down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam wishes. [generalized laughing] Kelly, I'll take this one. Diwali is a Celebration of the Coronation of the God-King Rama. After his epic battle with Ravana, the Demon King of Lanka. It symbolizes the battle between good and evil...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, all right, all right, all right. This isn't 'Lord of the Rings'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I started biking into work. Josh does it and he lives a lot farther away than I do. And also it saves gas money, keeps me in shape... helps the environment. And now I know it makes me really sweaty for work.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Nice basket.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now, a lot of people say that Kelly is one in a million and that's true, but it's also not true. Because, frankly, there are literally billions of people just like Kelly in the world.  Here are some famous Indians. [slide show] Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. He is a Nobel prize-winning physicist. Impressive. Apu from the Simpsons. Hilarious. Indian. M. Night Shyamalan. 'The Village', 'Unbreakable', 'Sixth Sense', 'Sig... '

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I see dead people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Spoiler... alert.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He was dead the whole time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just stop it. [slide of Michael & Carol kissing] What's the... oh, whoa! [laughs] Where did that come from?

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Karen, my chips got stuck in the vending machine again. I need your skinny, little arms.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh. Did you shake it?

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Yeah, I shook it, I shook it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We have such a roller coaster thing, Karen and I.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: 'Scuse me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Roller-coastery friendship. Hot. Cold. On again. Off again. Sexual tension filled type of deal. It's very Sam and Diane.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: From 'Cheers'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And another thing about the Indian people... they love sex positions. I present to you the Kama Sutra. I mean look at that. Who's seen that before?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I have. That's the 'Union of the Monkey'.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, that's what they call it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This is the best meeting we've ever had.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I find this incredibly offensive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I find it beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, whatever Kelly wants to do in her own house is fine but we shouldn't all be subjected to it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Actually, she's right. This isn't appropriate. Why don't I take these.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, You're not going to collect them.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. This is delightful, charming culture.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My Indian Culture Seminar was going great until Toby decided that he was too immature to deal with culturally explicit images. It's just sex. People... everybody does it. I'm doing it... with Carol! Probably tonight.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: All right. Think you guys should be all set. Oh, here's the corporate card for dinner.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: And Karen? Let's keep it to twenty dollars a person this time.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Once a quarter, the sales staff at this branch has to stay late to do order form consolidation... which, amazingly, is even less interesting than it sounds.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You guys ready to party?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I said are you ready TO PARTY!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Isn't this fun? Not wearing shoes?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wish some of us still had our shoes on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Stop it. It's a disease! I've told you.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: [wearing cheerleader costume] I thought you said this was a costume party!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [points at woman] What does that look like to you?

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: An Indian woman in a sari.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No one's even going to notice.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice outfit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Kevin. It's a costume. Why don't you just cool it, okay? Carol? Carol.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll have one of those as well. Thank you very much. Now these are limes, lemons, onions...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm a vegetarian. What can I eat?

quotes.speaker: Server
quotes.text: It's all vegetarian.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'll just have some bread. You used your hands.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yuck. [spits out food]

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: What? Too spicy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. These s'mores are disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: They're not s'mores. They're samosas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think they have any s'mores?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All they are is chocolate, graham cracker, and marshmallow. How difficult would that have been?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So, you're Kelly's sisters, huh?

quotes.speaker: Girls
quotes.text: [laugh] Kelly Zach Braff [speaks in Hindi]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ruka, Nipa, Tiffany. Stop acting like such little losers and just be cool. Come on, Ryan. Come on. Leave him alone. I hate you guys.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: They said something about Zach Braff.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Don't even listen to them. They're so...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, you don't...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Very official.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I decided to come. Uh... I feel a little under-dressed... but at least I'm not dressed like a slutty cheerleader, right? Is that mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Temp! Temp! Pflut! Pflut!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't even want to hear it. Okay. I didn't come this Diwali to get yelled at!

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Mom
quotes.text: Stop it right now. Ryan is a temporary worker, makes no money. Wally is a whole doctor. So handsome.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Uh... excuse me. I want to get a...

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Mom
quotes.text: He's a perfect match.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Big Tuna, you ready?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One. Two. Three. Shot!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Holy Mother of God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, that burns! Golly. Um...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Overhead
quotes.text: [song by Beyonce Knowles] Looking so crazy, my baby. I'm not myself lately. I'm foolish. I don't do this. I've been playing myself. Baby I don't care. Cuz your love got the best of me. And baby you're making a fool of me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, thirty years? And you two only met once before the wedding night?

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Father
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Father
quotes.text: How long have you been married to the cheerleader?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! She's not a cheerleader. She thought this was a costume party! Um... no, we're not married... yet!

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Mom
quotes.text: She is very fair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She is. Very fair and very kind. So... um... tell me, is your marriage the kind of thing where when you die she has to throw herself on a fire? No? Okay. It's still very cool. Ok. Thanks!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One. Two. Three. Shot!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to be. [to DJ] Hi, I'm just going to get this for a sec... just a sec. [speaks in microphone] Um... everyone? I'm sorry, could I have your attention, please. Thank you. Ah-hah... Hi. Sorry. I just have an announcement to make. Um... okay. I have learned a lot about Indian culture tonight. But I have learned even more about love. And I know you're all thinking 'who is this crazy gringo and what is he talking about?' Well, I'm not crazy. Maybe I'm crazy in love. So without further ado, Carol? Carol Stills. I would like you to do me the honor of making me your husband.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: Awww!

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Oh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you say?

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Can we talk about this in private?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't hear you. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: [louder] Can we talk about this in private?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [lowers microphone] Oh, you've got to be kidding me. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. I get it. I get it. You're not ready. We'll wait. This is a classic...

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: This is the ninth date, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, but I ... I feel like I've known you many lifetimes. Maybe I'm Hindu after all. Okay, I'm not Hindu, but... Carol. Carol, I just... I feel like... I just like you so much.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: I better go. Okay, you can find a way home, all right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Okay. Good night. [louder] Hey, you know what? Why don't I come with you. Cause I've got this book called the Kama Sutra.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Okay, good night, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Good night.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, I was a Temp but I got promoted. So, um... the compensation is a lot more competitive.

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Mom
quotes.text: So you're saving money...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Mom
quotes.text: ...to start a family and home.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, um... or travel. And,um... and buy an Xbox.

quotes.speaker: {kelly}'s Father
quotes.text: Is there anything you wanted to ask us tonight?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you believe my boss proposed to his girlfriend in public? That is so Michael.

quotes.speaker: Young Man
quotes.text: Is it? He's really outgoing, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Hey, would you excuse me for a second?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's hot in there. How's the naan?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dry. You look like you were having fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I am. You should come dance with us.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have to watch our shoes so they don't get stolen. Who were you texting?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings Indigo Girls] I went to the doctor. I went to the mountains. I looked to the children...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Andy, no acappella.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings] I looked to the children, I drank from the fountain.

quotes.speaker: {andy} and {jim}
quotes.text: [sing] There's more than one answer to these questions pointing me in a crooked line

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait, wait.

quotes.speaker: {andy} and {jim}
quotes.text: [sing] the less I seek my source...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, come on, guys. Please.

quotes.speaker: {andy} and {jim}
quotes.text: [sing] the closer I am to fi-i-i-ne. The closer I am to..

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: It's not good.

quotes.speaker: {andy} and {jim}
quotes.text: [sing] fi-i-i-ine!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: TUNA! Are you kidding me!!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God! [chokes on food] Oh. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here. [hands drink]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's so spicy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. You waiting for a call?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh... no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Pam. When Carol said 'No.' tonight, I think I finally realized how you must be feeling. We are both the victims of broken engagements.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you were never really engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was in that marriage arena, though.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Uuuuh... well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I kind of thought something would happen tonight too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're so alike. So alike. [leans in to kiss her]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm rejecting your...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm... what? I didn't

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ...kiss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [scoffing noises] Can I have a ride home?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If you sit in the back.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Goodnight, guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I have a ride, man? I... uh... I have my bike.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No way, dude. I am not driving home. I have brought an inflatable bed for just such occasions. You're welcome to share it though. It's a roomy twin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey dummy, get in the car!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm a drunk driver.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yes, you are. Here. Let me take that. Just... uh... get in the car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Man, you can really hold your liquor, Billabelli.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, you can't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No kidding. And I am just going to lie down in the back, if that's all right.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Sure. Here's your bag. Just don't puke on anything. You okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So good.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: These are not my shoes. This is just like that show 'Taxi Cab Confessions'.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You say one more word; I'm stopping the car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is going out to Indians everywhere. It's a tribute to one of the greats... Mr. Adam Sandler. [sings] Diwali is a festival of lights. Let me tell you something. Tonight has been one crazy night. So put on your saris, it's time to celebrate Diwali. Everybody looks so jolly. But it's not Christmas, it's Diwali. The goddess of destruction Kali stopped by to celebrate Diwali. Don't invite any zombies to a celebration of Diwali. Along came Polly to have some fun at Diwali. If you're Indian and you love to party, have a  happy, happy, happy, happy Diwali. Happy Diwali!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [loud clapping, cheering, and whistling]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do I explain this to Jan?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, well, basically, it's like a really big party, and everybody gets super-dressed up, and there's a bunch of different gods, and each of the gods has a special power, like the Care Bears, you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, please, stop talking. Three words or less.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Like, an Indian Halloween?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: An Indian Halloween. Okay, great. [to phone] Pam, could you put Jan on, please?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Michael, you're on with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, what is this about you letting everyone leave work early today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I was letting everybody go to the big Diwali party.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What is Diwali?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is Diwali?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't know what Diwali is? Wow, Jan. I'm surprised. It's the Hindu festival of lights. I just assumed you'd be familiar with it. It's the most sacred and honored Hindu holiday in the world. It's like Christmas, Easter, and Halloween--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mich--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: --rolled into one.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I bet you're not even aware that our own Kelly Kapoor, who works in...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, customer service.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ... customer service is a Hindu person.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, of course, I know Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought she was Muslim.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What? I'm not Muslim!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I think it sounds lovely. I think it sounds like a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You do?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, of course. It's important to celebrate our company's rich diversity. And, and in fact, Michael, if you had planned better, we might have been able to charter a bus to the event--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I dunno about that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: --or, or, or been a sponsor for the party itself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: For Kelly, that seems a bit much.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hey, one person is an integral part of the fabric--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: She's so wonderful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, you should see her naked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I had promised Carol a romantic evening on the town. Um, I wanted to take her on this spooky hay ride thing, but it was like seventy dollars a person, and she's allergic to hay. So I said, "Pop a Claritin, and I will spot you the seventy bucks," and she's like "I don't like to borrow money or take unnecessary medication."  And I'm like, "Well you're really not gonna like what I slipped in your drink last night." And she's like, "What the hell are you talking about?" And I'm like, "I'm kidding. I didn't put a roof..." [cracks himself up] ... We laughed so hard... It was hilarious... oh... [calms down] So yes, I'm very excited about the Diwali party.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: For Diwali 07, you must consider Scrantonicity. For a fraction of the cost of this DJ, you could have the rocking sound stylings of a Police cover band.

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Kapoor
quotes.text: No Police cover.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, okay, well, let me send you a demo, and... Better yet, I'll give Kelly the demo, and she can give it to you. It'll save us both on postage.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Kapoor
quotes.text: [nods]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: You're the temp!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, yeah. [shakes her hand] Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Hi, I'm Carol.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hi, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: The wavy brown hair and blue eyes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Michael talks about you... a lot.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Top of your class at business school, and you live on Shady Hill Road, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Wow, um... Sorry you had to...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does Michael talk about me a lot?

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: [pause] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He does? What does he say.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: He says... "I love him." He loves you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: At Cornell, in my fraternity, my house name was "Hubble" because I was so good at finding a party. I was like a powerful space telescope, so... Freshman year, when my skin was still really bad, they called me El Guapo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Big Tuna, tuna?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, I got eel.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [speechless]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [looking for Jim's sushi] Eel... eel.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Didn't see that coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And perhaps the most important person to Indian culture, Sir Ben Kingsley. Because of him, the British left India, and then he became an actor like Ronald Reagan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Your shirt is buttoned wrong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, any questions?
